{ iso standard 10303 part(1011) version(0) } Person_organization The Person organization application module supports the requirement to identify an organization and, optionally, a person within it.
the specification of a data structure to identify an organization
the specification of a data structure to identify a person
the specification of a data structure to relate a person to an organization
the specification of a data structure to represent an address
an organization may have a related address
a person in an organization may have a related address
all identified people must be related to organizations
an alias for the identification for organizations
all things which are not involved in the specification of the concepts of addresses, organization identification or the identification of people in organizations

This clause describes usages of this module. This module must be used in the context of another module (e.g. Part and version identification) in order to define its attachments. If a simple unclassified classification is required, security_classification and security_classification_level can provide this.
If the classification is unclassified, the data structure would be:
#1128=SECURITY_CLASSIFICATION_LEVEL('unclassified');
#1129=SECURITY_CLASSIFICATION('','',#1128);
The classification would be assigned to the unclassified items through applied_security_classification_assignment.
If a classification of NATO confidential is required, security_classification and security_classification_level coupled with organization_assignment can provide this.
#1=ORGANIZATION($,'NATO',$);
#1128=SECURITY_CLASSIFICATION_LEVEL('NATO Confidential');
#1129=SECURITY_CLASSIFICATION('','A description of what NATO confidential means',#1128);
#1147=PERSON_AND_ORGANIZATION_ROLE('classification_officer');
#1148=APPLIED_ORGANIZATION_ASSIGNMENT(#1,#1147,(#1129));
If a classification of 'super secret' is required by an organzation designated as COMSEC, security_classification and security_classification_level coupled with organization_assignment can provide this.
#1=ORGANIZATION($,'COMSEC',$);
#1128=SECURITY_CLASSIFICATION_LEVEL('super secret');
#1129=SECURITY_CLASSIFICATION('','A description of what COMSEC super secret means',#1128);
#1147=PERSON_AND_ORGANIZATION_ROLE('classification_officer');
#1148=APPLIED_ORGANIZATION_ASSIGNMENT(#1,#1147,(#1129));
